isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - Install ignition KEY SWITCH CYLINDER

svcproc.title: Install ignition KEY SWITCH CYLINDER
svcproc.para: The door lock and the ignition key switch are coded the same so that one key will operate both cylinders. The code number is stamped on the ignition key switch body just in back of the cap nut. The code number does not appear on the door lock assembly.
If the original key is desired when replacing the ignition key switch cylinder, code the new ignition key switch accordingly. Use the following steps:
Refer to Figure 160 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Insert original key (Item 1) in new ignition key switch cylinder (Item 2). Before insertion into ignition key switch body, file off tumblers that protrude from cylinder. Make certain that no burrs are left on tumblers, and that all filings are blown out with compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 160. Original Key in New Ignition Key Switch Cylinder

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To reinstall same ignition key switch cylinder, or to install a new ignition key switch cylinder (Item 1), apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to tumblers, then insert ignition key (Item 3) into ignition key switch cylinder. Rotate ignition key counterclockwise to accessory position and insert ignition key switch cylinder back into ignition key switch body (Item 2). Turn key to Off position and remove key.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 21 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position ignition key switch (Item 2) at dash panel and connect electrical connector (Item 1) to back of ignition key switch.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 20 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position ignition key switch (Item 2) up behind dash panel (Item 1) and insert it into dash panel opening.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 19 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With ignition key switch (Item 5) pushed through dash panel (Item 2) and positioned properly, install mounting cap nut (Item 4) securing it to dash panel. Tighten snugly.
Reinstall left side trim panel (Item 3) and install push-in fasteners and screws, then reinstall front trim panel (Item 1) underneath dash panel (Item 2) and install push-in fasteners and screws.
